meanings.definition: To hurl or launch something with a catapult.
meanings.sent1: The kids were catapulting water balloons into the air.
meanings.sent2: She catapulted the ball across the field with great force.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was catapulting acorns at the unsuspecting birds.
meanings.sent4: His words catapulted her into a fit of laughter.
meanings.sent5: The rocket was catapulting towards the moon, leaving a trail of fire behind.

meanings.definition: To move or be moved suddenly and forcefully in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The car was catapulting down the hill uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The sudden gust of wind catapulted the leaves into the air.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party catapulted her into excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her heart catapulted with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster catapulted them through twists and turns at high speed.
